Expense Tracker Modules

Views module for managing expenses.

This module contains functions to display a list of expenses, add, edit, and delete expenses with authorization protection.

expenses.views.expense_list(request)

Display a list of user’s expenses with filtering and sorting options.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request from the user.

Returns:

Rendered page with filtered and sorted expenses list.

Return type:

HttpResponse

expenses.views.add_expense(request)

Handle the form to add a new expense.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HTTP GET or POST request.

Returns:

Redirect to expenses list on success or

page with form to add expense.

Return type:

HttpResponse

expenses.views.edit_expense(request, pk)

Handle editing of an existing expense.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – HTTP GET or POST request.

  • pk (int) – ID of the expense to edit.

Returns:

Redirect to expenses list on success or

page with edit form.

Return type:

HttpResponse

expenses.views.delete_expense(request, pk)

Handle deletion of a specific expense.

Parameters:

  • request (HttpRequest) – HTTP GET or POST request.

  • pk (int) – ID of the expense to delete.

Returns:

Redirect to expenses list after deletion or

confirmation page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

expenses.views.delete_all_expenses(request)

Handle deletion of all expenses for the user.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HTTP GET or POST request.

Returns:

Redirect to expenses list after deletion or

confirmation page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

class expenses.models.Expense(*args, **kwargs)

User expense model.

The user to whom the expense belongs.

Type:

date

The date of the expense.

Type:

date

Inner class:

CategoryChoices (TextChoices): Possible expense categories.

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class incomes.models.Income(*args, **kwargs)

ForeignKey

The amount of the income.

Type:

DecimalField

The type or source of the income, chosen from predefined description choices.

CharField

date

The date the income was recorded.

Type:

DateField

accounts.views.register_view(request)

Handle user registration.

Processes POST requests with user registration data using Django’s built-in UserCreationForm. On successful registration, redirects to login page. For GET requests, displays the empty registration form.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered registration form or redirect to login page.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.login_view(request)

Handle user login.

Processes POST requests with login credentials using Django’s AuthenticationForm. On successful authentication, logs in the user and redirects to the dashboard page. For GET requests, displays the empty login form.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered login form or redirect to dashboard.

Return type:

HttpResponse

accounts.views.logout_view(request)

Log out the current user and redirect to the login page.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – HTTP request object.

Returns:

Redirect response to the login page.

Return type:

HttpResponseRedirect

main.views.dashboard(request)

Render the dashboard page showing total incomes, expenses, balance, and chart data filtered optionally by date range.

Parameters:

request (HttpRequest) – The HTTP request object, may contain GET parameters “start_date” and “end_date” for filtering data.

Returns:

Rendered dashboard page with context data including:

  • total incomes and expenses,

  • balance,

  • JSON-encoded data for charts of expenses by category and incomes by description.

Return type:

HttpResponse
